content.question: Which of the following best describes the greenhouse effect on Earth?

choices.label: Greenhouse gases trap heat near Earth’s surface, keeping the average surface temperature constant.
Greenhouse gases create a relatively warm inversion layer, which traps pollutants near Earth’s surface.

Greenhouse gases filter out <math alttext="U V B" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>UV-B</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> and <math alttext="U V C" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>UV-C</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> radiation, shielding living things from harmful solar radiation.
Greenhouse gases are emitted from human activities such as the combustion of fossil fuels and agricultural practices.

content.answer: Greenhouse gases trap heat near Earth’s surface, keeping the average surface temperature constant.
